radiographic_examinations.findings: The gallbladder is markedly distended, with a small amount of layering sludge and adherent stones at the fundus. There is circumferential gallbladder wall edema, measuring up to 6 mm. A trace amount of pericholecystic fluid is noted at the fundus. The liver is normal in echogenicity, without focal lesions. Normal hepatopetal flow in the portal vein. The common duct measures 5 mm. The pancreatic head and body are normal, and the pancreatic duct is nondilated at 3 mm.
